metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5838 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WordPress before 4.5.3 allows remote attackers to bypass intended password-change restrictions by leveraging knowledge of a cookie.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-5838` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.3+dfsg-1').
